justification: Trade frames a veteran WR + rookie RB for established RB + young WR and nods at playoff schedules, but it barely models Team B’s urgent-win mindset or preference for established talent (they’d be losing Liam Carter). It also ignores Team A’s injury-cautious stance while asking for an Out WR (Ben Miller). Roster fit is plausible—B upgrades WR now and has RB depth—yet the rationale is generic and thin on specific motivations or uncertainties.
